description: Learn how TypeScript integrates with JavaScript projects, tooling, and major frameworks like React, Vue, and Node.js.

content.content: TypeScript can be gradually introduced into existing JavaScript projects. JSDoc comments allow you to use TypeScript's type system without fully converting files to `.ts`.

items: Use `//@ts-check` to enable type checking in JS files.
JSDoc comments can describe types and parameters in JS files.

content.content: Using proper tooling improves code quality, consistency, and developer experience. ESLint and Prettier help enforce rules and format code, while `tsc` and `ts-node` run and type-check TypeScript files.

items: Prettier ensures consistent formatting across teams.
`ts-node` allows running `.ts` files directly without compiling.

content.content: TypeScript integrates seamlessly with modern frameworks. Use it to type props and state in React, define component interfaces in Vue, and build safe APIs in Node.js.

items: Use generics to type React components and hooks.
Use `defineProps` and `defineEmits` in Vue 3 for type safety.
Leverage type-safe APIs in Node.js using Express or tRPC.
